intro: Cacalia involucrata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually blue or purple. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation.
